intro: Sarosanthera leiopetala, commonly known as the smooth-leaved starflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. Its leaves are typically smooth and革质 (leathery), which helps it retain moisture in its high-altitude habitat. Sarosanthera leiopetala is often found in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, humid conditions.
